com.facebook.react.bridge

Interface CatalystInstance

  • All Superinterfaces:
    JSInstance, MemoryPressureListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CatalystInstanceImpl

    public interface CatalystInstance
extends MemoryPressureListener, JSInstance
    A higher level API on top of the asynchronous JSC bridge. This provides an environment allowing the invocation of JavaScript methods and lets a set of Java APIs be invokable from JavaScript as well.

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Destroys this catalyst instance, waiting for any other threads in ReactQueueConfiguration (besides the UI thread) to finish running. Must be called from the UI thread so that we can fully shut down other threads.

      • extendNativeModules

        void extendNativeModules(NativeModuleRegistry modules)
        This method permits a CatalystInstance to extend the known Native modules. This provided registry contains only the new modules to load.

      • addBridgeIdleDebugListener

        void addBridgeIdleDebugListener(NotThreadSafeBridgeIdleDebugListener listener)
        Adds a idle listener for this Catalyst instance. The listener will receive notifications whenever the bridge transitions from idle to busy and vice-versa, where the busy state is defined as there being some non-zero number of calls to JS that haven't resolved via a onBatchCompleted call. The listener should be purely passive and not affect application logic.

      • removeBridgeIdleDebugListener

        void removeBridgeIdleDebugListener(NotThreadSafeBridgeIdleDebugListener listener)
        Removes a NotThreadSafeBridgeIdleDebugListener previously added with addBridgeIdleDebugListener(com.facebook.react.bridge.NotThreadSafeBridgeIdleDebugListener)

      • setGlobalVariable

        void setGlobalVariable(java.lang.String propName,
                       java.lang.String jsonValue)

      • getJavaScriptContextHolder

        JavaScriptContextHolder getJavaScriptContextHolder()
        Get the C pointer (as a long) to the JavaScriptCore context associated with this instance.

        Use the following pattern to ensure that the JS context is not cleared while you are using it: JavaScriptContextHolder jsContext = reactContext.getJavaScriptContextHolder() synchronized(jsContext) { nativeThingNeedingJsContext(jsContext.get()); }
